results.title: Niue
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Oceans of Dreams - Currents of Change Series”.
Niue is the world’s largest coral atoll and the world’s smallest nation. A New Zealand protectorate from 1901 until 1974, Niue is now self-governing. All Niueans are New Zealand citizens and this has encouraged a trend in depopulation; 10,000 Niueans live in New Zealand, 2,300 live on Niue itself. The island enjoys a high standard of living but is isolated through poor transport and communication links. It also has the problems of a tiny economic base, and trying to retain a cultural identity. The film examines the contemporary issues and challenges facing Niue and its people.

results.title: Nitrous oxide, oxygen, ether, anaesthesia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Technique of anaesthesia”.
This film shows the working of a typical apparatus designed to deliver a continuous flow on nitrous oxide to the patient. Ether in varied quantities can be added to the mixture of gases as required. One animated diagram sequence in the film deals with the way in which the machine works; another deals with the principle of re-breathing. Induction and maintenance of anaesthesia are demonstrated with emphasis rather on the use of the machine than on general principles.

results.title: Nitric acid
results.creator_credit: Sutherland Educational Films, Chem Study (Manufacturing Chemists Assoc Inc U S A) and Harry H Sisler
results.brief_description: With live action and animation applies fundamental principles to the descriptive chemistry of nitric acid. Demonstrates how nitric acid may act as an acid, as a base, and as an oxidising agent.

results.title: Nirvana: Hina dolls
results.brief_description: Looks at the Hina Festival in Japan. Special dolls are displayed not as toys, but to symbolise the spirit of Japan and to embody the past experiences of the Japanese people.

results.title: Nirvana Street murder
results.creator_credit: Fiona Cochrane, Vellis, Cochrane Productions and Aleksi Vellis
results.brief_description: This film tells the story of two brothers. One brother is a law abiding citizen who looks after a wealthy bedridden old lady in his spare time and tries desperately to win over the Greek immigrant parents of his girlfriend. The other is a likeable but dangerously off-the-wall criminal type who is sheltered by his ditzy pregnant girlfriend. A confrontation with the police and their Greek counterparts tears everything apart. The clash of cultures and turfs is a strong element in the story, which generally roars along with a mixture of comedy, violence and drama. Stars Ben Mendelsohn, Mark Little, Mary Coustas and the late Sheila Florance.

results.title: Niok
results.brief_description: Tells the simple, enchanting story of Ayot and his friends who live in a Cambodian village. They capture a baby elephant they name Niok and bring him back as a pet. The other boys tire of Niok but Ayot teaches him to manage his own food, baths and follow him. The villagers complain about the elephant’s appetite for their grain and Niok is sold; but Ayok pursues the party, retrieves Niok at night from a ship and releases him at the temple where he had first captured him.

results.title: Ninotchka
results.brief_description: The ads proclaimed “Garbo laughs!” and back in that banner movie year of 1939, moviegoers everywhere joined in the laughter as the legendary actress starred in her first romantic comedy, “Ninotchka”. Garbo plays a dour, severe Soviet official who comes to Paris on business involving the the sale of some Czarist jewels. Soon business turns to pleasure as she discovers the special magic of Paris and succumbs to the charms of a suave Frenchman named Leon D’Algout (Melvyn Douglas).

results.title: Ninja scroll (D)
results.creator_credit: JVC, Toho Kabushiki Kaisha, Movic, Shigeaki Komatsu, Haruo Sai, Masaki Sawanobori and Yoshiaki Kawajiri
results.brief_description: Feudal Japan - a time of danger, intrigue and deception. Jubei is a masterless ninja who travels the land alone, hiring his services to those with gold or a worthy cause. An evil conspiracy is at work to overthrow the Government. Jubei reluctantly joins forces with a mysterious old man and the beautiful but tragic Kagero, in an effort to defeat the Shogun of the dark and his demonic cronies. Not surprisingly this is a struggle that involves huge amounts of action, violence, bloodletting, sex, supernatural powers and transmogrification. The animation is an impressive though slightly incongruous blend of detailed architecture, evocative landscape and highly stylized action figures. It will also interest followers of popular culture. Citizens Award Winner, 1993 Yubari City International Adventure Fantastic Film Festival. PLEASE NOTE THAT THIS ANIMATED FILM HAS AN ‘R’ RATING FOR PERSONS OVER THE AGE OF 18 DUE TO THE EXPLICIT VIOLENT AND SEXUAL NATURE OF ITS CONTENT.

results.title: Ninety nine bottles of beer
results.creator_credit: Don Horter, Los Angeles County Film Unit, Board of Supervisors and the Commission on Alcoholism and C. Michael McCulloch
results.brief_description: A remarkable film for young people…about young people…on alcohol abuse. The film simply relates actual experiences and feelings of young people as they relate to alcohol. No authoritarian viewpoint is exhibited thus permitting the audience to arrive at their own conclusions.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Horter, Los Angeles County Film Unit, Board of Supervisors and the Commission on Alcoholism and C. Michael McCulloch

results.title: Ninety degrees south
results.brief_description: This famous film is the official record of Captain Scott’s last Expedition to the Antarctic in 1912. The film tells of the hazardous journey to the South and includes the last photographs of Scott, Evans, Wilson, and Oates, who were lost. In photographing this film, Herbert Ponting, “Camera Artist” to the Expedition, faced great hardships and narrowly escaped death on a number of occasions. 1934 soundtrack added to original silent documentary of 1912.
